report:
CT CHEST WITH CONTRAST
        
        CLINICAL HISTORY: Follow-up of lung cancer with fungal infection.
        
        FINDINGS:
        1. Right upper lobe mass measures 3.2 x 2.8 cm (previously 4.1 x 3.5 cm),
           representing partial response to therapy.
        2. Multiple bilateral pulmonary nodules with surrounding ground-glass halos,
           largest measuring 8mm in right lower lobe.
        3. Small cavitary lesion in left lower lobe with air-crescent sign.
        4. Small right pleural effusion.
        
        IMPRESSION:
        1. Partial response of primary lung tumor.
        2. Findings consistent with pulmonary fungal infection.
        3. Small right pleural effusion.
clinical_history: Follow-up of lung cancer with fungal infection.
reported_response: Partial response of primary lung tumor.

classifications.description: Right upper lobe mass showing partial response to therapy, decreased to 3.2 x 2.8 cm from 4.1 x 3.5 cm.
Bilateral pulmonary nodules with surrounding ground-glass halos and small cavitary lesion with air-crescent sign consistent with pulmonary fungal infection.

other_findings.description: Surrounds multiple bilateral pulmonary nodules, largest nodule measuring 8mm in right lower lobe.
Small cavitary lesion in left lower lobe displaying an air-crescent sign.
